results.adx_keywords: Bicycles and Bicycling;Falls;United States Politics and Government;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Rehoboth Beach (Del)
results.title: Biden Takes Tumble During Bike Ride in Delaware
results.abstract: The president did not need medical attention after he fell off his bike at a state park near his vacation home in Rehoboth Beach, according to the White House.

media.caption: President Biden after falling off his bike at Cape Henlopen State Park in Delaware. He and the first lady were spending the weekend at their vacation home in Rehoboth Beach.
media.copyright: Sarah Silbiger for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Pregnancy and Childbirth;Abortion;Maternal Mortality
results.title: Sure, Just Have the Baby
results.abstract: There are good reasons American women overwhelmingly choose having an abortion over giving up a child for adoption.

results.byline: By Mike McIntire, Glenn Thrush and Eric Lipton
results.title: Gun Sellers’ Message to Americans: Man Up
results.abstract: The number of firearms in the U.S. is outpacing the country’s population, as an emboldened gun industry and its allies target buyers with rhetoric of fear, machismo and defiance.

media.caption: A man raffled off a golden AK-47 at the N.R.A. convention last month in Houston.

results.title: A Day After a Portrait of Pence in Danger, Trump Attacks Him Again
results.abstract: In a speech, Donald J. Trump was undeterred by the Jan. 6 House committee’s account of how his rioting supporters menaced the vice president, and the panel’s dismantling of many of his election lies.
org_facet: House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack

media.caption: In a speech on Friday in Nashville, former President Donald J. Trump continued to attack his former vice president for not blocking the certification of his 2020 defeat, even though doing so would have been illegal.

results.title: Vaccines for Young Children Are Coming, but Many Parents Have Tough Questions
results.abstract: The vaccines seem safe for children and are likely to protect against severe illness. But data on efficacy are thin, and most children have already been infected.
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

media.caption: Sunny Baker, 35, a mother of two in Oxford, Miss., with her 2-year-old daughter, Alma Pearl.

results.byline: By Glenn Thrush and Serge F. Kovaleski
results.title: Loopholes and Missing Data: The Gaps in the Gun Background Check System
results.abstract: The massive system already has major loopholes advocated by gun manufacturers to maintain easier access to firearms. The Senate’s proposed gun reform measures could fall victim to those same limitations.

media.caption: Shopping at Tobacco Valley Gun in East Windsor, Conn. The National Instant Background Check System contains built-in limitations, some of which exist because the gun lobby pushed to speed up gun sales.
media.copyright: Christopher Capozziello for The New York Times

results.title: Melatonin Isn’t a Sleeping Pill. Here’s How to Use It.
results.abstract: The “vampire hormone” can act like a dose of sunset, tricking your body into feeling like it’s time to sleep.

results.title: How a Dollar General Employee Went Viral on TikTok
results.abstract: Mary Gundel loved managing a store in Tampa, Fla. But when she detailed its challenges on social media, the company — and fellow employees — took notice.

media.caption: Mary Gundel, who managed a Dollar General in Tampa, Fla., created the hashtag #PutInATicket because, she said, that was the company’s response to serious store issues.

results.title: A Looming Threat
results.abstract: Russia’s invasion of Ukraine has civilians in Taiwan taking China’s aggression more seriously.

media.caption: Civilians participating in a battle simulation during a combat medic training workshop near Taipei in May. Since the war in Ukraine began, a growing number of Taiwanese have been making their own preparations for war.
media.copyright: Lam Yik Fei for The New York Times

results.title: Clint Bowyer, Former NASCAR Driver, Involved in Fatal Car Accident
results.abstract: Mr. Bowyer, now a Fox Sports analyst, called 911 and showed no sign of impairment after striking a woman with his car on a Missouri highway on June 5, the authorities said.

media.caption: Clint Bowyer in 2019. The authorities in Lake Ozark, Mo., said he showed no sign of impairment after he had struck and killed a woman who was walking on a divided highway on June 5.

results.title: Despite Growing Evidence, a Prosecution of Trump Would Face Challenges

results.title: FINA Restricts Transgender Women From Competing at Elite Level
results.abstract: The international swimming federation said transgender women who had experienced male puberty could not compete in women’s events.

media.caption: Lia Thomas, a transgender woman, swimming at the Ivy League women’s swimming and diving championships in February. The new FINA policy will bar swimmers like her from elite women’s competitions.

results.title: These 90-Year-Old Runners Have Some Advice for You

results.title: Juneteenth Is a Federal Holiday, but in Most States It’s Still Not a Day Off
results.abstract: One year after President Biden made Juneteenth a federal holiday, 26 states have not authorized the funding that would allow for state employees to take the day off.

media.caption: Juneteenth celebrations in Brooklyn. New York is one of the states that gave state employees paid time off to commemorate the day last year.

results.title: Texas Republicans Approve Far-Right Platform Declaring Biden’s Election Illegitimate
results.abstract: The platform, which was voted on at the Republican state party convention in Houston, was the latest sign of Texas conservatives moving further to the right.

media.caption: A resolution adopting the false claim that former President Donald J. Trump was the victim of a stolen election in 2020 was passed by Republican state-party delegates in Texas.
